page.title: 01SECTION OF CHERWELL VALLEY
page.content: The block consists of a transect across the Cherwell Valley having the Oxford Canal and the Bicester-Banbury and Oxford Banbury railways alongside the river. Primarily it is a thinly populated farming area with only one village. Farming is mostly arable but with some milk and beef cattle based on the water meadows. The main crop is barley, with some wheat and rape and fodder beans occasionally seen. The farms are medium sized, 140-240 hectares, employing only 2-3 men with the working farmer. Most of the land is used for shooting with some rearing of pheasants and duck. The area attracts retired people while the USAF Base at Upper Heyford puts pressure on housing. There is not much new housing development. The Oxford Canal has summer visitors in hired narrow boats.
